maml:description.maml:para: Adds Azure subscription data to lab

The cmdlet adds the Azure subscription data from an Azure RM profile generated by Save-AzureRmContext to the lab definition, creates or selects the default resource group, default location and default storage account. It caches the possible VM sizes and installation offers/skus for the selected location. The location can either be pre-selected or auto-generated based on response time.
The full path to the exported AzureRM profile
The name of the subscription to select, if necessary
The default location to choose
The default storage account to choose
The default resource group to choose
Returns the lab's subscription
The full path to the exported AzureRM profile
The name of the subscription to select, if necessary
The default location to choose
The default storage account to choose
The default resource group to choose
Returns the lab's subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds the subscription selected in the exported profile and creates a lab resource group $labname in the default location

The certificate store location
The certificate store name

maml:description.maml:para: Adds user rights on lab machines

Adds user rights on a lab machine from the following rights: 'SeNetworkLogonRight', 'SeRemoteInteractiveLogonRight', 'SeBatchLogonRight', 'SeInteractiveLogonRight', 'SeServiceLogonRight', 'SeDenyNetworkLogonRight', 'SeDenyInteractiveLogonRight', 'SeDenyBatchLogonRight', 'SeDenyServiceLogonRight', 'SeDenyRemoteInteractiveLogonRight', 'SeTcbPrivilege', 'SeMachineAccountPrivilege', 'SeIncreaseQuotaPrivilege', 'SeBackupPrivilege', 'SeChangeNotifyPrivilege', 'SeSystemTimePrivilege', 'SeCreateTokenPrivilege', 'SeCreatePagefilePrivilege', 'SeCreateGlobalPrivilege', 'SeDebugPrivilege', 'SeEnableDelegationPrivilege', 'SeRemoteShutdownPrivilege', 'SeAuditPrivilege', 'SeImpersonatePrivilege', 'SeIncreaseBasePriorityPrivilege', 'SeLoadDriverPrivilege', 'SeLockMemoryPrivilege', 'SeSecurityPrivilege', 'SeSystemEnvironmentPrivilege', 'SeManageVolumePrivilege', 'SeProfileSingleProcessPrivilege', 'SeSystemProfilePrivilege', 'SeUndockPrivilege', 'SeAssignPrimaryTokenPrivilege', 'SeRestorePrivilege', 'SeShutdownPrivilege', 'SeSynchAgentPrivilege', 'SeTakeOwnershipPrivilege'
The computer name the rights are being granted on
The user name to be granted rights
The array of rights to assign to the user
The computer name the rights are being granted on
The user name to be granted rights
The array of rights to assign to the user

dev:remarks.maml:para: Assigns SeInteractiveLogonRight,SeServiceLogonRight to domain\myServiceUser on FS1

maml:description.maml:para: Not implemented
Not implemented
Starts the process of lab deployment

If called without any parameters, Install-Lab will: - Create all necessary base (parent) disks for all operating systems to be used in the lab - Create all virtual networks to be used in the lab - Create all machines to be used in the lab - Deploy and configure all machines defined in the lab in following order: Root DCs Routing DHCP Servers First child DCs Additional DCs Create AD trusts Certificate (CA) servers SQL servers 2008/2008R2/2012/2014 Web servers Orchestrator servers 2012 Exchange servers 2013 Sharepoint servers 2013 Visual Studio Office 2013 Start any machines without any AutomatedLab roles
If called with parameters, only the action(s) specified by the parameters will be performed.
Create virtual networks
Create base images (parent disks)
Create lab machines
Start installation of Root DCs, First Child DCs and additional DCs. Note that lab machines with Routing role (if any), will be installed between Root DCs and First Child DCs.
Start configuring of AD trusts between all AD forests in the lab
Start installation of DHCP servers
Start installation of machines with Routing role
Start all post insallations of machines with this defined
Start installation of all SQL servers. SQL servers will be installed in batches of 4.
Start installation of all Orchestrator 2012 servers
WebServers
Start installation of all Exchange 2013 servers
Start installation of all Sharepoint 2013 servers
Start installation of all Certificate (CA) servers
Start installation of all Config Manager 2012 servers
Start installation of Visual Studio on all lab machines with this defined
Start installation of Office 2013 on all lab machines with this defined
Start all remaining machines which are not already started
Create checkpoints between each AutomatedLab role. Ie Checkpoint between AD and CA and SQL etc
Seconds to wait between starting each lab machine
Disable validation of the lab configuration (and thereby missing out on avoiding common configuration errors)
Create virtual networks
Create base images (parent disks)
Create lab machines
Start installation of Root DCs, First Child DCs and additional DCs. Note that lab machines with Routing role (if any), will be installed between Root DCs and First Child DCs.
Start configuring of AD trusts between all AD forests in the lab
Start installation of DHCP servers
Start installation of machines with Routing role
Start all post insallations of machines with this defined
Start installation of all SQL servers. SQL servers will be installed in batches of 4.
Start installation of all Orchestrator 2012 servers
WebServers
Start installation of all Exchange 2013 servers
Start installation of all Sharepoint 2013 servers
Start installation of all Certificate (CA) servers
Start installation of all Config Manager 2012 servers
Start installation of Visual Studio on all lab machines with this defined
Start installation of Office 2013 on all lab machines with this defined
Start all remaining machines which are not already started
Create checkpoints between each AutomatedLab role. Ie Checkpoint between AD and CA and SQL etc
Seconds to wait between starting each lab machine
Disable validation of the lab configuration (and thereby missing out on avoiding common configuration errors)

dev:remarks.maml:para: Deploy and configure all machines defined in the lab in following order: Root DCs Routing DHCP Servers First child DCs Additional DCs Create AD trusts Certificate (CA) servers SQL servers 2008/2008R2/2012/2014 Web servers Orchestrator servers 2012 Exchange servers 2013 Sharepoint servers 2013 Visual Studio Office 2013 Start any machines without any AutomatedLab roles
Creates all needed base images if these are not already present. Size and/or integrity is NOT checked/verified. If the base image (disk) exists, it will considered good.

Creates all needed base images if these are not already present. Size and/or integrity is NOT checked/verified. If the base image (disk) exists, it will considered good.
All virtual network to be used in lab will be created.
Same as first example but lab will be attempted validated/checked for common configuration errors. Not recommended. Use only if experiencing issues.

Deployment/configuration of all domain controllers, all Certificate (CA) servers, SQL servers and Web servers will be performed.
There will be a deplay of 30 seconds start of each machine if more than one machine is required to start at the same time. Use to avoid disk congestion (spread the 'load').
Remaining machines (typically those without any AutomatedLab role), will be started and checked for readiness before contiuing.
None

maml:description.maml:para: Create forest trust
Creates DNS forwarders and a bidirectional trust for all forests in the current lab
Enable ADFS

Configures the Active Directory Federation Services for the current lab by generating certificates from the lab CA, creating a service user and the necessary DNS entries as well as setting up an ADFS farm
Create ADFS proxy
Configures an ADFS proxy for existing ADFS lab machines by retrieving a valid certificate for one ADFS machine and then installing a web application proxy
Install domain controllers
Installs lab domain controllers after the root and child domains have been set-up and the RootDC and FirstChildDC machines have been installed
The DC promo restart timeout, i.e. how long we should wait for the restart after the DC promo to complete

The timeout in minutes how long we should wait for the installation

Installs all lab machines with the role FirstChildDc after all RootDCs have been installed. This will set-up all child domains for a given lab

Install SQL servers

Installs all SQL servers in the current lab with the configured installation properties of each server. The valid properties include: Features InstanceName Collation SQLSvcAccount SQLSvcPassword AgtSvcAccount AgtSvcPassword RsSvcAccount AgtSvcStartupType BrowserSvcStartupType RsSvcStartupType AsSysAdminAccounts AsSvcAccount IsSvcAccount SQLSysAdminAccounts SQLServer2008
The timeout in minutes we should wait for the installation to finish
Indicates if a checkpoint should be created after installing SQL
The timeout in minutes we should wait for the installation to finish
Indicates if a checkpoint should be created after installing SQL

maml:description.maml:para: Invoke command on a lab vm

Invokes a script block or a script file on a lab VM with the ability to add function definitions and variables for the script block to use. Scripts and script blocks can also use a dependency folder containing dependencies.
The name of the activity to execute
Indicates if the post installation activities defined in the lab should be processed instead of a script block
The computer names
The argument list for the script block or the script
Indicates if CredSSP should be used
Indicates if the machines' local credentials should be used

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$ALocallyDefinedVariable = "This is a" $AndAnother = "Test" function Get-SomeThingOnMyLocalMachine { Write-Host "$ALocallyDefinedVariable $AndAnother" }
Invoke-LabCommand -ActivityName GetStuff -ComputerName DC1 -ScriptBlock {Get-SomeThingOnMyLocalMachine} -Variable ALocallyDefinedVariable,AndAnother -Function (Get-Command Get-SomeThingOnMyLocalMachine) -UseLocalCredential -Retries 3 -RetryIntervalInSeconds 20

dev:remarks.maml:para: Invokes a script block calling a locally-defined function on the machine DC1. The locally-defined function as well as the two local variables are passed to the VM before the script block is executed

maml:description.maml:para: Join a VM to a domain
Joins one or more lab VMs to their defined domain
The lab machines
The lab machines

Remove deployment data
Removes the following files and folders used to deploy the machines from all running lab machines: c:\unattend.xml c:\WSManRegKey.reg c:\DeployDebug
Remove the lab

Fully removes the current lab, the lab stored at a specific location or a named lab. For Azure-based labs, the lab resource group is removed completely, regardless of additional machines deployed to the resource group

Updates the parameters used by a function by either using the AutomatedLab bound parameters or a parameter set that is passed to the function. Common parameters will be skipped

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: The example uses the bound parameters to synchronise the parameter set for the cmdlet Set-MachineUacStatus and calls the function with the synchronised parameters

maml:description.maml:para: Tests a file hash
Tests a file hash against a list of cached file hashes produced by Save-Hashes
The list of file hashes
The list of file hashes

The file list

Tests if a TCP or a UDP port is open on the specified machine

Unblock lab sources
Unblocks all lab sources in order to be able to properly execute all scripts and downloaded files
Update Azure settings
Updates the lab's Azure settings after e.g. Add-LabAzureSubscription is called
Update an ISO
Updates a lab iso image by adding installable hotfixes from a location to the ISO and saving it
The source ISO
The target ISO

Wait for the lab AD
Waits for the lab Active Directory to be ready by waiting for the Active Directory Web Services and executing Get-ADDomainController
The machine names the test will be executed on

Indicates that no new line should be present in the output

Waits for a lab machine to accept incoming sessions, indicating that it is ready to be used
Wait for machine restart

The machine names to be waited on
The wait timeout in minutes
Indicates the machines that should be started while waiting for the VM restart
Indicates that no new lines should be present in the output
not implemented

not implemented
Wait for machine shutdown
Waits for one or more lab machines to shut down
The machine names

The machine names
The shutdown timeout in minutes
Writes a .
Writes a . to the output without a new line to indicate that the operation is still running
Write a .
Writes a . to the output and appends a new line to indicate that the operation is completed its last step
Write to console

Writes formatted output to the console window and tracks installation time. Proper indentation is achieved by using the switch parameters TaskStart and TaskEnd to indicate that a specific task has been entered or left
The message to write
A time span indicating the first time delta in the output
A time span indicating the second time delta in the output
The type of the message, e.g. Error
Indicates that no new line should be appended to the output
The amount of levels to indent the output
Indicates that a specific task has been started
Indicates that a specific task has ended

A time span indicating the first time delta in the output
A time span indicating the second time delta in the output
The type of the message, e.g. Error
Indicates that no new line should be appended to the output
The amount of levels to indent the output
Indicates that a specific task has been started
Indicates that a specific task has ended
Add a resource manager profile to the lab configuration
Automatically add any Azure resource manager profiles with a filename called *.azurermsettings to the active lab description by calling Add-LabAzureSubscription
Indicates that the subscription data should be passed back to the caller
Indicates that output should be ignored
Indicates that the subscription data should be passed back to the caller
Indicates that output should be ignored
Get Azure storage data

Gets the ResourceGroupName, StorageAccountName, StorageAccountKey and Path of the lab sources file storage. To be able to use the cmdlet, you need to Add-LabAzureProfile or Add-LabAzureSubscription before.
Create Azure lab source storage
Creates the resource group AutomatedLabSources and a random storage account with a file share called labsources on it in your subscription
Removes the lab sources
Removes the resource group containing the lab sources completely
Sync local lab sources to Azure
Synchronize your local lab source depot to Azure. OS ISOs will automatically be skipped, otherwise there are no limitations. All files are hashed to ensure that no existing files are overwritten
Get lab sources location
Internal function to retrieve the lab sources location. The function is also called each time the dynamic variable $labSources is evaluated
Indicates that the local lab source folder should be located, e.g. when syncing files to Azure
Indicates that the local lab source folder should be located, e.g. when syncing files to Azure
